TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TrustInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This class represents the application security trust information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resets the object to its default state of full trust.
Determines whether the application has permission to call unmanaged code.
Docs.value: A Boolean value indicating whether the application has permission to call unmanaged code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks "Application" refers to the application for which the manifest is being read. You can read the deployment manifest using <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.ReadManifest%2A> or <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.ReadManifest%2A>.

Docs.summary: Determines whether the application is full trust or partial trust.
Docs.value: A Boolean value indicating whether the application is full trust or partial trust.

remarks.format: ## Remarks "Application" refers to the application for which the manifest is being read. You can read the deployment manifest using <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.ReadManifest%2A> or <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.ReadManifest%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the permission set object for the application trust.
Docs.value: A PermissionSet object for the application trust.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether to preserve partial trust permission when the full trust flag is set.
Docs.value: A Boolean value indicating whether to preserve partial trust permission when the full trust flag is set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Normally when <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.IsFullTrust%2A> is set to `True`, all permission settings are deleted. If you want to preserve these settings (typically during design time), you can call this method to persist the permission settings even when <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.IsFullTrust%2A> is set to `True`.
`PreserveFullTrustPermissionSet` should not be set to `True` for ClickOnce deployments because this violates ClickOnce schema requirements.
If this property is set to `False` with full trust specified, then any permissions defined in the permission set object will be dropped on save.

Docs.summary: Reads the application trust from an XML file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The data stream must contain only a \<TrustInfo> section and no other data.

Docs.param: The name of the input file.
Docs.summary: Reads the application trust from an XML file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The specified string must contain only a \<TrustInfo> section and no other data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ReadManifest(class System.IO.Stream input) cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads the application trust from a ClickOnce application manifest.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ReadManifest(string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the input file.
Docs.summary: Reads the application trust from a ClickOnce application manifest.
Gets or sets the level of same site access permitted, specifying whether the application has permission to communicate with the server from which it was deployed.
Docs.value:
A string indicating the level of same site access permitted. The values can be or .
specifies that the application can call Web services at the same URL from which it was deployed; if deployed from a share, the application has permission to read files from that share.
specifies that the application can neither access Web services from the same URL from which it was deployed, nor access files from the share from which it was deployed.
"Application" refers to the application for which the manifest is being read (using <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.ReadManifest%2A>).

remarks.format: ## Remarks "Application" refers to the application for which the manifest is being read. You can read the deployment manifest using <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.ReadManifest%2A> or <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo.ReadManifest%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns all the information in the application security trust object as a string.
Docs.returns: A string containing the information in the application security trust object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Write(class System.IO.Stream output) cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes the application trust to an XML file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method updates only the \<TrustInfo> section in a file containing only the \<TrustInfo> section and nothing else.
The specified stream must contain only a \<TrustInfo> section and no other data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Write(string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the output file.
Docs.summary: Writes the application trust to an XML file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method updates only the \<TrustInfo> section in a file containing only the \<TrustInfo> section and nothing else.
The specified string must contain only a \<TrustInfo> section and no other data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteManifest(class System.IO.Stream output) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies an output stream to which to write the updated manifest file.
Docs.summary: Writes the application trust to a new template ClickOnce application manifest.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method updates only the \<TrustInfo> section in a file containing only the top-level manifest header, the \<TrustInfo> section, and nothing else.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteManifest(string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the output file.
Docs.summary: Writes the application trust to a ClickOnce application manifest.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method updates only the \<TrustInfo> section in a file containing only the top-level manifest header, the \<TrustInfo> section, and nothing else.
This overload of the method will update the file in place (that is, the input file is the same as the output file). If the file exists, the trust section will be updated. If the file does not exist, a new template manifest with the specified trust will be created.

MemberSignature.Value: public void WriteManifest (System.IO.Stream input, System.IO.Stream output);
.method public hidebysig instance void WriteManifest(class System.IO.Stream input, class System.IO.Stream output) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies an input stream containing the manifest to be updated.
Specifies an output stream to which to write the updated manifest file.
Docs.summary: Updates an existing ClickOnce application manifest with the specified trust.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method updates only the \<TrustInfo> section in a file containing only the top-level manifest header, the \<TrustInfo> section, and nothing else.
